instruction: What program does the Sociology department offer at EWU?
response: The Sociology department offers the Bachelor of Social Science (BSS) in Sociology program at EWU.

instruction: How many total credits do I need to graduate in Sociology at EWU?
response: To complete the BSS in Sociology, you need a minimum of 123 credits.

instruction: Can you break down the courses required for the Sociology program?
response: The program includes several types of courses: 18 Compulsory General Education courses, 9 Compulsory Foundation courses, 57 Required Core courses, 33 Elective courses, and 6 credits for Individual Research, Practicum, or Internship.

instruction: How many general education courses do I have to take in Sociology?
response: You are required to complete 18 Compulsory General Education courses as part of the Sociology program.

instruction: What are the foundation course requirements for the BSS in Sociology?
response: The program includes 9 Compulsory Foundation courses designed to give you essential knowledge and skills needed for your major studies.

instruction: How many core courses are required in the Sociology program?
response: You must complete 57 Required Core courses in the BSS in Sociology program, which form the main part of your major.

instruction: Can I choose electives in the Sociology program?
response: Yes, the program includes 33 Elective courses, giving you flexibility to explore areas of interest within or related to Sociology.

instruction: Is there any research or practical work included in the Sociology degree?
response: Yes, the program includes 6 credits dedicated to Individual Research, Practicum, or Internship, allowing you to gain hands-on experience.

instruction: How can I understand the total workload of the Sociology program?
response: The total program requires 123 credits, which are distributed among General Education, Foundation, Core, Elective, and Research/Practicum/Internship courses to provide a well-rounded education.

instruction: What is the capstone requirement for the BSS in Sociology program?
response: All undergraduates in the BSS in Sociology program must undergo a viva-voce examination for either a Research Project/Monograph or a Practicum/Internship. This defense contributes 30% of the total marks for the course. Students can choose one option from Individual Research, Practicum, or Internship to fulfill this requirement.

instruction: Which courses can I take for the capstone requirement in Sociology?
response: For the capstone, you can choose one of the following courses: 1) SOC413 - Research Project/Monograph (6 credits), or 2) SOC414 - Practicum and Internship (6 credits). Both require Senior Standing as a prerequisite and fall under the Research Practicum category.

instruction: How many credits is the capstone course worth in the Sociology program?
response: Each capstone course—SOC413 Research Project/Monograph or SOC414 Practicum and Internship—is worth 6 credits.

instruction: Do I need to complete both Research Project and Practicum for my capstone?
response: No, you only need to complete one option. You can choose either the Research Project/Monograph (SOC413) or the Practicum and Internship (SOC414) to satisfy the capstone requirement.

instruction: When can I take the capstone courses in Sociology?
response: Both SOC413 and SOC414 require Senior Standing, so you should enroll in them during your final year after completing the majority of your core and elective courses.

instruction: How important is the viva-voce for the capstone course?
response: The viva-voce examination for the capstone course is very important as it accounts for 30% of the total marks for the Research Project/Monograph or Practicum/Internship.
